游戏做的不错，还没鬼服，到了晚上会有2-3个房间在玩，推荐打折购买！
这个游戏突突一类的后坐力大的出翔，尤其是机枪（在没有架设的情况下），这个游戏狙用好了就是1枪1个（因为是满伤害！没错，打中了基本都死）
真的好玩，尤其后坐力习惯之后，手感一上来感觉真的好棒

Still a classic WWII shooter that is quite active. Like other source-engine games, performance is good. Despite other reviews, I've had a decent time with the community in this game, but I'm typically not using a mic. People are generally nice and the game is fun. Buy it.

This might just be for me, since i'm a sucker for early internet culture, but this game is a blast.

Its a little upsetting now damn near nobody plays thing game anymore, and there is literally no fan content being released outside of the steam page.

I wouldn't recommend you buy it at full price, but if it ever goes on sale, just nab it! I'm sure you'll get a kick out of these FPS veterans barking at each other.

游戏对后坐力的设定较为真实，不适合fps新手，压枪难度较大，除了没人玩都挺好，还有比前做少了好多东西。。。嘤军直接没了。“胜利之日”前半生的成功源于它同时具备来自玩家群体的热诚和创意以及来自游戏厂商的规划与资本；失败的后半生则是由于厂商对画面、新引擎的盲目追求和对电竞趋势的盲目跟从。想怀旧或者体验一下的话也可以下载机器人Rcbot2，AI还可以。
games awesome
Good old hardcore school

I never thought I'd see myself spending more than a couple hours across a random session or two on this game and dismissing it as another "fun but I don't see myself playing this regularly" kind of Valve game. Boy was I wrong...

It feels a bit too early to say it considering 36 hours is nothing compared to what some people have achieved, but at the same time you really have to ask yourself how people manage to spend a triple, if not quadruple hours on such a seemingly dated game. That's when I came to the realization that this game truly has a charm in a similar way like TF2 does.

Albeit similar in gameplay, even though the DoD franchise will never be as influential as TF is, I can definitely see the appeal in playing this awesome casual combination of various gameplay mechanics and overall WW2 theme. Quite a pleasant surprise really, not much else to say.

While it is a decent game, the first DoD is unrivaled inside and out yet strong and illustrations. Assuming that you wouldn't fret HL time illustrations, I suggest playing the first all things considered. DoD:S has less guides, less cflasses, less weapons. What it has are a few new choices like iron sights, rifle projectiles and select discharge choices, which are largely essentially futile. They attempted to make the classes more unique however I'm apprehensive in the process they lost the sensation of the game.
In any case, that doesn't mean, that DoD:S is an awful game. An incredible opposite. The awesome ongoing interaction is still there. It's only substandard compared to the first.
